Construction would take about 18 months compared to over 5 years for Silvertown Tunnel which won’t even have a cycle lane (but then who would want to cycle alongside HGV’s?). And it costs less, much less!

urls.title: Anger as Environment Agency executive takes job at Southern Water
urls.description: Critics say move an example of ‘cosy relationship’ between industry and regulator

text:
Anger as @EnvAgency executive takes job at Southern Water https://t.co/UrqITYeM6J

Dr Toby Willison, Executive Director of Operations (and former Acting Chief Executive) at the EA, is joining Southern Water as Natural Capital and Environment Director. https://t.co/i9FHSlp8nG

Three training sessions to go! Community Emergency Volunteer Coordinator tonight at 6pm, Looking After Your Wellbeing & Supporting Others tomorrow 10.30am and Flood Volunteer tomorrow 2pm @CommunitiesPrep @EnvAgencySW @MindinSomerset @somersetprepare 
https://t.co/UBU2E0nKGg

@EmmaHowardBoyd @theCCCuk @EnvAgency @WRIClimate @UKCRP_SPF @AtmosScience @GCAdaptation @AdaptOurWorld @AdaptationCCC @DefraGovUK @FCDOClimate We must reduce emissions, you say? Your @EnvAgency just handed out a permit for Europe’s largest waste incinerator at Rivenhall in rural north Essex. 600,000 tonnes of rubbish will be burned per year and all delivered by 200 lorries per day. How does that reduce CO2 emissions?
